alert.note: Alert for Jackson; Lavaca (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 25 at 10:12AM CST until January 27 at 1:20PM CST by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas... Navidad River at Strane Park affecting Jackson County. Navidad River near Speaks affecting Jackson and Lavaca Counties. Navidad River at Sublime affecting Lavaca County. Lavaca River near Edna affecting Jackson County. For the Navidad River...including Sublime, Speaks, Morales, Strane Park...Major flooding is forecast. For the Lavaca River...including Komensky, Breslau, Hallettsville, Edna...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Navidad River near Speaks. * WHEN...Until early Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 28.0 feet, Major lowland flooding begins with the river several hundred yards wide in the vicinity of the gauge. Approaches to the FM 530 bridge are flooded and impassable. Much of the floodplain is cut off endangering livestock. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM CST Thursday the stage was 25.5 feet. - Bankfull stage is 21.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:00 AM CST Thursday was 25.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 28.1 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage early Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 24.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 28.2 feet on 04/19/2009. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (12 pm CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Navidad River Speaks 24.0 25.5 Thu 9 am CST 26.6 17.4 9.1 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this eveninglate tonight at 415 AM CST.
